programme.title: UFO Files
programme.desc: The bloodless murder of livestock has plagued farmlands worldwide for generations. This programme considers the possible involvement of extraterrestrial beings in the act.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts make surprising discoveries as they explore the ancient past for evidence of alien overseers.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi have to break some bad news to the staff of one of their stores, while Rene tries to dominate his rivals.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The latest round of auctions prompts a career-changing bid from Ivy, while Jarrod and Brandi's Long Beach store is mired in gossip.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Les question Ashley's skills of diplomacy after observing her interact with several customers.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth and Ashley compete to sell the most goods, with the loser having to pay a forfeit. A musician with limited funds seeks a new bass to replace the one he has broken.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: The Spider-Man co-creator teams up with Daniel Browning Smith to find people with abilities that would not seem out of place in one of his comics.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: The case of a man found murdered in his burnt-out apartment in 1988, and how it took two decades to find the killer - a surprising culprit with a particularly sadistic side.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams bargain for an old Ford Transit and an ageing tractor to strip to a shell and sell on as parts for the highest sum of cash possible. Narrated by John Challis (car dealer Boycie in Only Fools and Horses).

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Greg Davies sets his celebrity contestants challenges involving snowglobes, rubber ducks and wooden spoons. Alex Horne helps coax the contestants.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Stand-up and actress Jo Brand takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz, with broadcaster and journalist Grace Dent and comedian Kiri Pritchard-McLean joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig has a Christmas knees-up in the pub with Alan Davies, Cariad Lloyd, Josh Widdicombe and Noel Fielding. Pub-themed questions are the order of the day, with a sprinkling of festive cheer along the way.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: John Bishop, Chris Addison, Joanna Page and Patsy Palmer join team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves in the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.sub-title: Would I Lie to You? - The Unseen Bits
programme.desc: A compilation of unseen material from this series of the comedy panel show hosted by Rob Brydon. Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by celebrity guests to dupe their opponents with plausible lies, featuring contestants including Ronnie Corbett, Bernard Cribbins, Richard E Grant, Jack Dee, Martin Clunes, Julian Clary and Sanjeev Bhaskar.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Host Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis serve up their unique festive take in a Christmas special filled with seasonal material, out-takes, best bits and hitherto unseen moments.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: At the Ffestiniog and Welsh Highlands Railway, manager Stephen Greig is trying to ensure that all goes to plan ahead of the opening of the new station at Caernarfon.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story behind the Krupp company, who were responsible for the manufacture of two of Germany's most feared war products - the Panzer Tank and the U-boat.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: The Royal Palace of Caserta near Naples, Italy, which was created by Luigi Vanvitelli and houses a silk factory that dates back to the 18th century and still functions to this day.

programme.title: World's Greatest Palaces
programme.desc: Kensington Palace in London, which began life as an early 17th-century Jacobean mansion before becoming a palace fit for the monarchy, and was the brainchild of Christopher Wren.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: The accidental fatal shooting of a Polish teenager in an armed police operation sparks a series of murders, which links Turkish gangsters, a grieving family and a fractured firearms unit. As the inquest delivers a lawful killings verdict, IPCC investigator Vicky Sharpe calls on the Lyell team to investigate the connection between the events and review the police evidence, but Sharpe's relationship with the family of the teenager and her suspicion of the firearms division lead Nikki and Thomas to distrust her motives. Feature-length episode, starring Emilia Fox.

programme.title: The White Princess
programme.desc: The York princesses are strategically married off to strengthen the Tudor cause, but further political challenges are on the horizon. When King Henry finds himself back on the battlefield to protect his reign, Lizzie learns that the threats they face may be closer to home. Jodie Comer, Jacob Collins-Levy, Suki Waterhouse and Michelle Fairley star.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: Hugh faces chaos at home and work, with a mutiny on the farm following a drunken evening and a deadly pregnancy crisis with Hayley.

programme.title: The Heart Guy
programme.desc: The opening of Hugh's new cardiac clinic is upset by life-changing news from his ex-wife, and Charlie's life is thrown into disarray when her father makes a visit.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Inside The Rebellion
programme.desc: An exclusive report from Sky News Climate Change Correspondent Hannah Thomas-Peter on the UK's most controversial activists.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: Sky News on the Hour
programme.desc: Review of the latest international news, with sport, weather and financial updates.

programme.title: World News
programme.desc: A comprehensive look at the biggest stories from around the globe.

programme.title: Hotspots: On the Frontline
programme.desc: Veteran war zone journalists Stuart Ramsay and Alex Crawford illustrate the dangers, complexities and emotions of reporting from troubled spots around the world.

programme.title: World News
programme.desc: A comprehensive look at the biggest stories from around the globe.

programme.title: Carols at Christmas 2019
programme.desc: Myleene Klass leads the congregation of St Elisabeth's Church, Stockport in a traditional Christmas Eve carol service. The celebrations include festive performances from singer-songwriter KT Tunstall, musical theatre group Collabro, big-band crooner Mark Kingswood and West End star Marisha Wallace.

programme.title: Casino Royale (1967)
programme.desc: Ageing spy James Bond comes out of retirement to tackle a mysterious mastermind who wants to take over the world. Meanwhile, another agent disguises himself as Bond to face the evil genius over the baccarat table. Spoof spy adventure, starring David Niven, Peter Sellers, Woody Allen, Orson Welles, Deborah Kerr and Ursula Andress.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Make It Pop
programme.desc: Adventures with good friends and room-mates Sun Hi Song and Corki Chang.

programme.title: Wishfart
programme.desc: The city is overtaken by terrifying and delicious hordes of gingerdead cookies. As the trio take shelter, they realise that they must find the cause of the disaster.

programme.title: Jamie Laing's Luxury Christmas: Top 20
programme.desc: This is how Chelsea does Christmas! Heat Radio DJ and reality TV star Jamie Laing hosts the swankiest Christmas ever, with seasonal songs from Sam Smith, Little Mix and Mariah Carey.

programme.title: It's An 80s Christmas
programme.desc: We're jumping back in time to bring you some massive hits from Christmas time in the 80s.

programme.title: That Christmas Feeling
programme.desc: Once again the famous Magic Christmas provides the soundtrack to your seasonal celebrations. We'll be playing all your festive favourites until you've finished your final turkey sandwich.

programme.title: Merry Kissmas!
programme.desc: It's the biggest and best RNB tracks of all time in one place as our gift to you! Merry Kissmas.

programme.title: 2019's Biggest Hits
programme.desc: What a year it's been for music! We've got all the biggest hits of 2019 right here.

programme.title: Merry Christmas From The Box!
programme.desc: Merry Christmas! Enjoy a selection of seasonal treats to soundtrack your special day.

programme.title: Party Like It's Christmas!
programme.desc: HITS CHRISTMAS!! we're here to get your xmas party started with some of the best party tracks alongside some great xmasy videos.

programme.title: Merry Hits-mas
programme.desc: Providing you with all of the festive feelgood tunes this christmas.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How tunnels are built and the secret of the lion dance. Plus, a device that removes rain water from sports fields, allowing play to resume faster.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tracks down a Jaguar Mark 2 - but is later left to reflect whether the purchase has been a wise one as mechanic Edd China reports a list of serious defects.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: The host, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Phill Jupitus and Kerry Godliman, oversees a clash between The Burrell Arms from West Sussex and The Manor House from Coventry.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Featuring people who demonstrate an unusual affection for their cars, and a vicious, endless battle between cars and bikes.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Cameras capture more road-based disasters, including hot rides going up in flames, freaky motorcycle wipeouts, and unsettling 'redneck' car hobbies that defy all logic.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Rain causes two race cars to collide, a blaze breaks out at a fireworks stand, a truck accident collapses a motorway and a raceboat disintegrates at 240mph.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A tornado tears through a town, an electrical short causes an explosion in a warehouse and a racing car crashes through a barrier, flips and bursts into flames.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: The team must deal with disgruntled truckers, equipment shortages and technical failures, and tensions between the workers jeopardise the whole operation.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs and the team intend to surprise a deputy sheriff when they take his 1965 Ford Thunderbird from right under his nose and give it the ultimate makeover.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.sub-title: My Deadly Face Tumour: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: A man with a facial tumour needs one more operation, but may not be able to face the procedure after a near-death experience.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: In 2012, young entrepreneur Terry Porter was found dead by his neighbour. There was no forensic evidence or witnesses, but surveillance footage was relied on for answers.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: When Louise Dickey is discovered brutally murdered in a bath of her own blood, police were stumped. However, nearby surveillance cameras may lead to the shocking truth.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Cases in which partners teamed up to commit murder, including execution-style killings by two taxi drivers in New Jersey. Plus, an insight into a new DNA identification technique.

programme.title: FBI Case Files
programme.desc: Officers investigate the abduction of Christine Aragao and her two young children in Miami just days before Christmas, hoping to determine who has kidnapped them before it is too late.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: The team visits a house near Detroit that has become overrun by aggressive feral cats.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Terrier Benji is suffering from a heart murmur that could be fatal without immediate surgery. Dr Chris Brown entrusts the dog's operation to Dr Andrew Marchevsky.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride is racked with indecision, and a customer who wants to look like a 'classy porn star' is in for a surprise.
